comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I wonder if Rothesay Bay refers to the place in Scotland rather than the ship.  Not a million miles away from Lochbuie, Isle of Mull (see following photo).

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] Nice one! I think this could be same vessel, same day from SLSA.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] The SLSA photo matches this one (the original negative?) - handle.slv.vic.gov.au/10381/12638 (linked by [http://www.flickr.com/photos/91549360@N03] on the NLI photo - credit where credit is due!)

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks BC! We do have a few more images of ROTHESAY BAY in the Sam Hood collection that are (at present) all low res. But seem to reflect the different paint jobs shown in the images from other institutions above. Stay tuned!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
